answers.text:
Hi Pam,
Thanks so much to reaching out to us with help with your question! Many cities have found that they are able to more effectively allocate resources when they analyze data about their performance with data analytics software, and it is encouraging to see that you are also striving for effective resource allocation. I Hope that you find a great model to follow!
The City of Williamsburg, VA was able chart performance on a variety of variables after it teamed up with private software developer EMGovPower (Charlotte, NC) to create a data management program. (http://icma.org/en/Article/100976/Efficient_Performance_Management_System)
Westminster, CO found that it was able to allocate resources for its parks program most effectively when they implemented a new performance measurement program.  (http://icma.org/en/icma/newsroom/highlights/Article/101306/Using_Performance_Measurement_in_the_DecisionMaking_Process) 
You may have the quickest luck with your search for this information by asking members in the Performance Measurement, Management, Organizational Development or Personnel Policies topic pages. 
I hope that this helps you find the information that you’re looking for.  Let us know if we can help you find any more information or resources.
Aloha,
James Davidson
Knowledge Network Intern
